content:
Item one,. If you want a backup of the gmail mail, use the Gmail takeout service. Thunderbird is not really meant to the purpose you are using it for and that may well be why you are having issues.

Thunderbird connects to each POP account every 15 minutes by default. It could be that between that and your antivirus product slowing things down that only a few email arrive before the download crashes and it has to wait another 15 minutes.

Note local copies of IMAP mail account can be considered nothing more than a local cache and mail in those account will be deleted it the server copy is not available so it is a terrible choice as a backup of anything.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Firstly, It makes no difference whether I download mail every week or every day, the behaviour is the same. I click on the "Get ALL NEW mail" button it only downloads 15 emails. If I click the button immediately again it downloads the next 15 emails and so on until all new emails are downloaded. Secondly, I do not see any error messages to say the email download has failed for any reason. Thirdly, clearly the "Get ALL NEW mail" button is not NOT downloading ALL NEW mail, it is downloading a subset of the available NEW emails, or should the button be renamed "Get partial new mail" Just a thought, maybe you could advise on something I could do to narrow down what the actual problem is?
creator: jhansonnz

content:
I have come across this sort of complaint in the past and it was gmail POP account.

It seems that gmail deliberately cause this nuisance when users have a Pop account to download mail, but they have the setting to Leave messages on the server. When server starts to get a lot of emails using up quota, gmail suddenly will only do limited downloads and it only gets worse as time progresses. It's almost as if gmail wants you to get annoyed, believe Thunderbird is a pain and logon to their webmail and use it instead.

In all of the cases, I advised to do the following and in all those cases it worked. So it's worth trying to see if this was the cause of your issue.

Logon to the gmail webmail account via a browser and delete a load of old mail. Pop accounts cannot put deleted mail into the server Trash folder, so gmail ends up with archiving old mail in the 'All Mail' folder. You can tell what is archived because the emails in 'All Mail' will not have any 'labels'. You need to delete emails from the 'All Mail' account that do not have any labels or if you have a load of emails in Inbox - delete them so they go into the gmail Trash and then you can empty the Trash. Basically get rid of your old emails of server. Pop account will have a copy of all emails because Pop account folders are independent of server.

In Thunderbird Make sure you have compacted Inbox folder to ensure all old traces of 'marked as deleted' mail are properly removed.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Many thanks for your constructive and detailed reply, I will try your suggestions at weekend and report back.
creator: jhansonnz

content:
If clearing cache and disabling extensions didn’t help, try starting Firefox in **Troubleshoot Mode** (Help > Troubleshoot Mode). This disables all add-ons and uses default settings, which can help identify if an extension or theme is causing the issue.

Also, ensure that your **graphics drivers are up to date**, and check Firefox’s **Hardware Acceleration** settings under *Settings > General > Performance*. Try disabling it and see if the issue persists.

Let me know if the problem continues after these steps!
creator: damonburton467

It's almost as if gmail wants you to get annoyed, believe Thunderbird is a pain and logon to their webmail and use it instead. In all of the cases, I advised to do the following and in all those cases it worked. So it's worth trying to see if this was the cause of your issue. Logon to the gmail webmail account via a browser and delete a load of old mail. Pop accounts cannot put deleted mail into the server Trash folder, so gmail ends up with archiving old mail in the 'All Mail' folder. You can tell what is archived because the emails in 'All Mail' will not have any 'labels'. You need to delete emails from the 'All Mail' account that do not have any labels or if you have a load of emails in Inbox - delete them so they go into the gmail Trash and then you can empty the Trash. Basically get rid of your old emails of server. Pop account will have a copy of all emails because Pop account folders are independent of server. In Thunderbird Make sure you have compacted Inbox folder to ensure all old traces of 'marked as deleted' mail are properly removed.

Thanks so much, this worked perfectly. I didn't know that Google throttled email downloads if I'm running low on space. Thanks again for the constructive answer. Others on here could learn from you.

creator: tthberg

content:
Beste tthberg, die "locatie" kan je zien wanneer je op je blad met je agenda, waar je normaal gezien (volgens je indeling) links onder de maandkalender, je Agenda's ziet staan en waar ook standaard de agenda "algemeen" staat (zie foto 1), kan je op je agenda (die van google dan die in de lijst staat) rechts klikt en "eigenschappen" selecteert. (zie foto 2). Daar zie je bij mij nu in het veld "locatie" iets staan dat begint met "https://apidata. enz..." voordien stond daar iets dat begon met "googleapi:// xxxx enz..." waarbij de xxx hier mijn Gmail adres was. Nu is het zo dat je die gegevens in het veld "locatie" niet kunt aanpassen. Maar als je die agenda terug aanmaakt (ik heb bij mij de oude niet eerst verwijderd om het verschil te kunnen zien en de nieuwe er dus gewoon terug bij aangemaakt en daarna de oude verwijderd) dan zal je zien dat in die nieuwe onder "locatie" staat wat ik hierboven heb aangegeven (dat met apidata). Maar, wat belangrijk is bij het aanmaken van je agenda is dat je dat op de volgende manier doet: - helemaal onderaan op de pagina met je lijst met agendas (zoals in foto 1) zie je staan: nieuwe agenda. Daar moet je op klikken. - dan kom je op een scherm "nieuwe agenda maken" waar een bolletje staat bij "op mijn computer" maar dat moet je zetten op "op het netwerk" (foto's 3a + 3b) en klik op "volgende" - Dan kom je in een scherm zoals foto 4a en daar vul je in zoals in foto 4b + 4c - voor die 4c moet je dus je URL van je Gmail kalender (die zal beginnen met "https://calendar.google.com/calendar/enz...") daar plakken. Dat doe je door eerst in je webbrowser naar je Gmail kalender te gaan en als je daar in zit, copieer je bovenaan de URL die je dan nadien "plakt" in het scherm waar je bezig was. - dan klik je op "agenda's zoeken" en dan wijst het zich verder zelf uit. Je moet dan o.a. je inloggegevens invullen in het google scherm waar je inkomt enz.

Succes in elk geval
creator: erik.wuyts

content: Beste tthberg, Ik heb het misschien nog wat te moeilijk gemaakt. Je kan dat copieren van die URL overslaan. Als je dat veld niet invult (dus 4c niet doen) maar direct klikken op "agenda's zoeken" dan wijst het zich ook verder uit en vult hij dat zelf juist in.

There's more to safe/troubleshoot mode than disabling add-ons. Check for a broken layout ('reset toolbars & controls', 'make changes & restart') or incorrect hardware acceleration settings, as the most likely factors besides add-ons:

content:
Thank you everyone for the suggestions.

As I was uninstalling the add-ons, my eye finally caught the Filter messages by: Sender, Recipients, Subject, Body.

I've never changed these and found out that the recipients was unchecked. Obviously checking that has now solved my problem with the quick search filter.

Thanks again.

content:
Are you really determined to get rid of your existing contacts. Uninstall and reinstall generally fixes exactly nothing. However folk frequently manage to loose all their historical email and contacts by doing so, and then look for someone to fix their fix.

If you are determined delete the profile folder. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data
creator: MattAuSupport

content: My problem was a bit different from just deleting my profile. I solved the problem with Revo uninstaller and deleted all files and folders which were connected with Thunderbird in any way. As I found out there were a lot of registry-entries and dlls and files left from Version 115 ( two Updates before) . The update process had not worked properly then. Afterwards I installed Thunderbird new and it worked. As I work with IMAP I did not loose much if any ( still synchronizing). What do you suggest for updating Thunderbird to avoid such a problem? Deinstall old Thunderbird first and do a new install?
creator: wolfganggegner

content:
Personally I would suggest deleting Revo and forgetting you ever heard of it, so I am probably not the one to ask for advice on fixing issues. My experiences here are folk who use Revo generally have ongoing issues.

If your issues were post an update, it was probably a rather long way around fixing your antivirus or firewall. That is what I am thinking based on the seriously minor amount of information you supplied. You never actually said what the problem was!

I can not begin to offer advice to prevent a future issue as I really do not know what you issue was. I like you have no idea what went wrong and your fix did not uncover that, so I am left guessing based on the thousands of post that I have seen over the last 10-15 years of folk not getting mail post update. I have seen perhaps a few instances where the issue was Thunderbird but they were rare and you have said nothing to indicate the issue was actually Thunderbird, so I assume your issue lies elsewhere.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: When I read your post, my first thought was that you may be looking at revo uninstall, which shows remnants of prior version as though it was still installed - when it is not. In general, these are harmless, as I regularly see revo uninstall showing i have two copies. My guess is your problem and the revo uninstall display are a coincidence. Reinstalling the bad release would likely have resolved the issue. Telling revo to uninstall the old version also causes it to remove components of the current version.

content:
I had a similar problem where I could not dismiss or snooze any past or future notifications, although I could close the dialog box it would just pop up again on schedule. I am using Ubuntu 24.04 not Windows and using TB 128.11 but this information might help

I tried the following:

  1. Delete the calendar, then add it back - no change
  2. Uninstall, then reinstall Thunderbird, add calendar again - no change
  3. Delete the events in Google calendar and add them back in - I could then delete any notifications that were not for birthdays.
  4. Delete the notifications for birthdays in Google calendar and then add them back in - Partial success. The dialog box no longer lists the edited birthdays and when the dialog box appears for other event types, I can dismiss or snooze them. However, as a test I created a new birthday event for tomorrow in my Google calendar with a notification 1 day before and when the dialog popped up, the dismiss button for that birthday wouldn't work.

If I figure out how to get the dismiss button in the dialog to work consistently for all events, I'll update this thread.

content:
The unread count for all folders can be hidden with css:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1426787#answer-1609463

For specific folders, try adding something like this to the code:

[data-folder-type="Trash"]
creator: sfhowes

content:
Something like this? [data-folder-type="Trash"] .unread > .container > .unread-count { 

   display: none !important;

}

I'm not good at css, and this isn't work.

I used this css to check or I had configured all in the right way: 

#folderTree {    background-color: red !important;

} and I'm pretty sure, that I had configured all in the right way, but first css doesn't work
creator: val125419

content:
Try something like this: 

ul#folderTree li[data-folder-type="trash"].unread > .container > .unread-count {   display:none !important; }


Reference: https://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?t=3129527
creator: sfhowes

content:
It works! But, if I need use the same for some another folders, some certain folders that I need, how can I check its folder type?

Alsa I have a problem, that counter is invisible now, but name of the Trash folder is hightlight
creator: val125419

content:
To make the Trash folder not change: 

ul#folderTree li[data-folder-type="trash"].unread > .container > .name { color: black !important; font-weight: normal !important; }


trash can be replaced by other generic folders such as inbox, sent, junk, drafts. Not sure how to apply it to arbitrary user-defined folders. For those, consider unchecking 'When getting new messages...' in folder Properties.

content: Prihláste sa priamo z webu, či vám v gmail nenapísali, že vám zamietli možnost prihlásenia sa, a že prípadný útočník pozná vaše heslo, a že môžete znížiť zabezpečenie a potom že to pôjde. Takže problém môže byť aj vo vyššom zabezpečení na strane google.com. Stáva sa to vtedy, pokiaľ sa použije v krátkom čase pri prístupe k vášmu účtu viac prehliadačov alebo viac IP adries k prihláseniu. „Nedávno jsme zabránili pokusu o přihlášení do tohoto zařízení. Uvedli jste, že jste tento pokus provedli vy. Pro účely zabezpečení se toto zařízení bude po dobu dvou týdnů zobrazovat v seznamu. Zmíněnou událost můžete také prověřit na stránce“ = Preverte či mate vypnuté dvojstupňové overenie: https://myaccount.google.com/security?pli=1#signin a zapnite aj prístup pre menej bezpečné aplikácie: https://www.google.com/settings/security/lesssecureapps = A ešte preverte na webe, či ste si vo svojom účte povolili POP, alebo IMAP prístup: http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/Gmail_POP3_povoleny.jpg http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/12/gmail_IMPAP.jpg = 1. Odstránte z Thunderbirdu jestvujúci účet na gmail.com 2. Ukončite a znova spustite Thunderbird 3. Vytvorte NOVÝ (ten odstránený ) účet 4. Nechajte Thunderbird, aby automaticky vytvoril tento účet na gmail.com. Nijak neupravujte automaticky nastavený POP a SMTP prístup k účtu. Iba zadajte správne prístupové MENO a prístupové HESLO. 5. Potom by to malo fungovať.

Reštartujte Thunderbird a zadajte správne prihlasovacie údaje k tomuto problémovému účtu: - Thunderbird - Nástroje - Nastavenia - Súkromie a bezpečnosť - Heslá - Uložené heslá - Zobraziť heslá

content:
There are a few suggestions here, but I tried the recommended one by replying to some html messages in plain text format, and it seems to work: 

* {word-wrap: break-word;}


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder (Win: Open Folder), close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userContent.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thanks, Matt. I'll try that. Signature Switcher is a great add-on, but not very user friendly.
creator: blackhorse161

content: Matt, I still need a little help. It looks as though Thunderbird only allows one signature per identity. I need multiple signatures per identity. Also, I'm not sure how I get the signature that I created in Thunderbird over to signature switcher. Thanks.
creator: blackhorse161

content:
Try this : click on 'Write' / 'New Message'

Remove all content Create the signature from scratch. Save as 'File'

Save in a suitable location eg: In 'Documents' I have a folder called 'Signatures' So I save the file as a html file in 'Signatures' and give it a suitable name like 'Personal' or 'Business'.

In Account Settings for name of account Select the 'Attach the signature from a file instead' Click on 'Choose' Locate that saved signature html file and click on 'Open'

Now clickon 'New Message' It opens showing the 'signature' Save as 'Draft'

Click on 'Drafts' folder select the saved email In the Message Header area - click on 'More' and select 'View Source'

This will show all the html code stuff. look for the line that starts - ok at this it's not helpful that posting code is not working via the usual method.

So I'll post an image - it's below - that shows an example of the bit of code you need to copy

Then open Signature Switch. In 'Signature Switch' Click on 'Add New Signature' Give it a suitable name eg: Formal, Love from Me, etc Paste the copied html stuff into the right side where it says HTML

Where it says 'Auto Switch' you can add specific email address. I have a Personal signature I use when sending emails to my children, so their email addresses are entered in that section and when I select to send to them it gets auto switched in the signature. Click on 'Save'

Now when you click on 'New Message' it may pop up with whatever signature is used in the Account Setting but you click on 'Signature switch' it offers the list of ones you created - select it and it auto swaps to what you want.

creator: josh98

content:
Hello, ich habe es eben mal getestet: die v31.2.0 installiert und ein IMAP Konto eingerichtet. Dabei wurde ein "xxxxxxxx.default" Profil erstellt, wie es mit dieser alten Version üblich war Dann die v136.0.1 in diesem Profil gestartet, TB hat das alte Profil xxxxxxxxx.default nicht erkannt und ein neues Profil yyyyyyyy.default-release angelegt, in dem ich das IMAP Konto neu einrichten musste.

Ich rate dir, mit der v136.0.1 ein völlig neues Profil zu erstellen. Wenn du nur IMAP Konten hast, sind diese schnell angelegt und du siehst sofort deine alten Nachrichten und Ordner. Wenn du POP-Konten hattest, wird die Migration etwas aufwendiger. Auf jeden Fall musst du auch die POP-Konten neu einrichten, danach müssen die POP-Kontenordner wie "pop.xxx.xx" aus dem Ordner "Mail" im alten Profilordner in den Ordner "Mail" im neuen Profil kopiert werden, wobei die schon vorhandenen Kontenordner pop.xxx.xx überschrieben werden. Wenn du die Lokalen Ordner zum Speichern oder Archivieren von Nachrichten benutzt hast, brauchst du nur den Ordner "Local Folders" aus dem Ordner "Mail" des alten Profils in den Ordner Mail deiner neuen Thunderbird-Einrichtung zu kopieren.

Die Adressbuchdateien haben im alten Profil die Endung .mab, zum Beispiel abook.mab für "Persönliche Adressen" und history.mab für "Gesammelte Adressen. Dies alten Adressbuchformate lassen sich problemlos über die Importfunktion in das neue Profil übernehmen.

Das erscheint kompliziert, aber wir können dir dabei helfen. Wichtig ist dass du deinen alten Profilordner gut aufbewahrst. https://mzl.la/2cYKHaB Am besten machst du davon noch eine Sicherungskopie. Wenn du dich nicht gut mit TB auskennst, mache keine unüberlegten Experimente, sondern frage hier zunächst nach.
creator: Mapenzi

content: danke für Deine Mühe und Antwort. Werde es mal versuchen.
creator: karlnass.kn

content:
> Kann ich einfach die neueste Version 136.0 herunterladen und aktualisieren?

Wie Mapenzi andeutet, sollten Sie nicht direkt mit einem bestehenden Profil auf die deutlich neuere Version 128 oder 136 wechseln.

Sie können Mapenzis Vorschlag oder eine Alternative verwenden, die in einem Knowledgebase-Artikel unter https://support.mozilla.org/kb/upgrading-older-version-thunderbird dokumentiert ist. Möglicherweise ist Mapenzis Vorschlag einfacher.

Solange Sie eine vollständige Sicherung Ihrer Daten erstellen, können Sie beides oder beides versuchen.

creator: volker58

content: Sounds to me like you are trying to use the Optus mail server to send mail for an address that is not with Optus. Something the whole world has been in the process of disallowing over recent years us relaying email using an outgoing server other than the one designated in DNS for use with that domain.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: No idea s to why at all. Other than your use of that email address perhaps on social media or other web sites. There is no way Thunderbird use can increase your spam. None! As all connections are undertaken between your device and your providers server, usually in an encrypted form. There are a few laggards out there that do not use encrypted connections, but they are few and far between and there is nothing the mail client can do to force companies that are living in the past with obsolete security to improve other than refusing to get your mail. When that happened back about 2016 everyone blamed Thunderbird for breaking their mail.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I don't use that email address on websites and I don't do social media. The question was based on the coincidence of the dramatic spam/junk increase after the cutover.

Thinking about it some more, it might be due to using a spam assassin program on that acct (as the one used by T-Bird crashes the app, so I removed it) that "bounces" the junk/spam emails.

Think I may have solved my own question!!! :)
creator: csfuser

content: You can display the "message pane" via View > Layout > Message Pane (or F8) and open messages with a simple click on a message in the thread pane so it will be displayed in the message pane. So you are no longer obliged to open messages by double-click in a new tab or a new window.

content: You don't need Firefox to take a screenshot of Thunderbird. But I don't need a screenshot since I understand your problem. Right-click on a tab opens a drop-down menu. Choose "Close other tabs" and all other tabs will be closed except for the "Mail-tab" on the left.
